banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: Lessons from a lifetime of bad advice
videoData.socialTitle: Lessons from a lifetime of bad advice

nodes.whoTheyAre: Nicole Wilson oversees corporate responsibility for Tommy Hilfiger North American Operations. She strives to ensure that Tommy Hilfiger addresses the typical environmental issues (water, greenhouse gas, waste and sustainable materials), works with internal and external partners on improving working conditions within the supply chain, develops improved testing protocols and safety procedures and introduces innovative ideas that lead to the reduction of operational costs or aid in increasing market share value from products that address environmental and social problems.

videoData.description: Nicole Wilson was 5 years old when she first realized that her father, a former professional football player and grade school teacher, gave bad advice. While she steered clear of his words of "wisdom" as a kid, as an adult she began to see an upside. In this fun, personal talk, she explains how a lifetime of bad advice taught her how to trust her own instincts.
